s.text: Albright's father, Josef Korbel , was a foreign-service officer in the liberal interwar Czechoslovakian government.

Albright's father, Josef Korbel , was a foreign-service officer in the liberal interwar Czechoslovakian government.
The Korbels and Simova continued to correspond after the war, and Simova met Albright briefly in Prague just after the Velvet Revolution in 1989.
There's also Albright's relationship with her Jewish first cousin , who still lives in Prague.
After the war, the family returned to Prague and learned, Albright says, that her three living grandparents had died.
No one criticizes Albright and her parents, refugees twice-over (first from Nazism, then from Communism), for how they chose to put their lives back together.
Western reporters in Belgrade say they have encountered people who recall reading press reports from the late '40s about Albright's family.
Multiple stories about it have appeared, for example, in major Czech newspapers.
